refnamediv.refpurpose: Container and functions for manipulating ArtBpaths

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Convenient container and functions for manipulating ArtBpaths, which are paths defined by line and curve segments.

refsect2.title: struct GnomeCanvasPathDef
refsect2.para: This structure should not be accessed directly. Use the functions defined below.

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_new ()
refsect2.para: This function creates a new empty gnome_canvas_path_def.

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_new_sized ()
refsect2.para: This funtion creates a new gnome_canvas_path_def with length number of points allocated. It is useful, if you know the exact number of points in path, so you can avoid automatic point array reallocation.

listitem.simpara: number of points to allocate for the path

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_new_from_bpath ()
refsect2.para: This function constructs a new gnome_canvas_path_def and uses the passed bpath as the contents. The passed bpath should not be static as the path definition is editable when constructed with this function. Also, passed bpath will be freed with art_free, if path is destroyed, so use it with caution. For constructing a gnome_canvas_path_def from (non-modifiable) bpath use gnome_canvas_path_def_new_from_static_bpath.

listitem.simpara: the new canvas path definition that is populated with the passed bezier path, if the bpath is bad NULL is returned.

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_new_from_static_bpath ()
refsect2.para: This function constructs a new gnome_canvas_path_def and references the passed bpath as its contents. The gnome_canvas_path_def returned from this function is to be considered static and non-editable (meaning you cannot change the path from what you passed in bpath). The bpath will not be freed, if path will be destroyed, so use it with caution.

listitem.simpara: the new canvas path definition that references the passed bpath, or if the path is bad NULL is returned.

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_new_from_foreign_bpath ()
refsect2.para: This function constructs a new gnome_canvas_path_def and duplicates the contents of the passed bpath in the definition.

listitem.simpara: the newly created gnome_canvas_path_def or NULL if the path is invalid.

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_ref ()
refsect2.para: Increment the reference count of the GnomeCanvasPathDef.

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_finish ()
refsect2.para: Trims dynamic point array to exact length of path.

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_ensure_space ()
refsect2.para: This function ensures that enough space for space points is allocated at the end of the path.

listitem.simpara: number of points to guarantee are allocated at the end of the path.

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_copy ()
refsect2.para: This function copies the contents src to dest. The old dest path array is freed and dest is marked as non-static (editable), regardless of the status of src.

listitem.simpara: a GnomeCanvasPathDef where the contents of src will be stored.
a GnomeCanvasPathDef whose contents will be copied it src.

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_duplicate ()
refsect2.para: This function duplicates the passed path. The new path is marked as non-static regardless of the state of original.

listitem.simpara: a GnomeCanvasPathDef which is a duplicate of path.

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_concat ()
refsect2.para: This function concatenates a list of GnomeCanvasPathDefs into one newly created GnomeCanvasPathDef.

listitem.simpara: a GSList of GnomeCanvasPathDefs to concatenate into one new path.

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_split ()
refsect2.para: This function splits the passed path into a list of GnomeCanvasPathDefs which represent each segment of the origional path. The path is split when ever an ART_MOVETO or ART_MOVETO_OPEN is encountered. The closedness of resulting paths is set accordingly to closedness of corresponding segment.

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_open_parts ()
refsect2.para: This function creates a new GnomeCanvasPathDef that contains all of the open segments on the passed path.

listitem.simpara: a new GnomeCanvasPathDef that contains all of the open segemtns in path.

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_closed_parts ()
refsect2.para: This function returns a new GnomeCanvasPathDef that contains the all of close parts of passed path.

listitem.simpara: a new GnomeCanvasPathDef that contains all of the closed parts of passed path.

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_close_all ()
refsect2.para: This function closes all of the open segments in the passed path and returns a new GnomeCanvasPathDef.

listitem.simpara: a GnomeCanvasPathDef that contains the contents of path but has modified the path is fully closed

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_unref ()
refsect2.para: Decrease the reference count of the passed path. If the reference count is < 1 the path is deallocated.

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_reset ()
refsect2.para: This function clears the contents of the passed path.

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_moveto ()
refsect2.para: This function adds starts new subpath on path, and sets its starting point to x and y. If current subpath is empty, it simply changes its starting coordinates to new values.

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_lineto ()
refsect2.para: This function add a line segment to the passed path with the specified x and y coordinates.

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_lineto_moving ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gnome_canvas_path_def_lineto_moving (GnomeCanvasPathDef *path, gdouble x, gdouble y);
refsect2.para: This functions adds a new line segment with loose endpoint to the path, or if endpoint is already loose, changes its coordinates to x, y. You can change the coordinates of loose endpoint as many times as you want, the last ones set will be fixed, if you continue line. This is useful for handling drawing with mouse.

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_curveto ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gnome_canvas_path_def_curveto (GnomeCanvasPathDef *path, gdouble x0, gdouble y0, gdouble x1, gdouble y1, gdouble x2, gdouble y2);
refsect2.para: This function adds a bezier curve segment to the path definition.

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_closepath ()
refsect2.para: This function closes the last subpath of path, adding a ART_LINETO to subpath starting point, if needed and changing starting pathcode to ART_MOVETO

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_closepath_current ()
refsect2.para: This function closes the last subpath by setting the coordinates of the endpoint of the last segment (line or curve) to starting point.

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_bpath ()
refsect2.para: This function returns a ArtBpath that consists of the path definition.

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_length ()
refsect2.para: This function returns the length of the path definition. Not Euclidian length of the path but rather the number of points on the path.

listitem.simpara: integer, number of points on the path.

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_is_empty ()
refsect2.para: This function is a boolean test to see if the path is empty, meaning containing no line segments.

listitem.simpara: boolean, indicating if the path is empty.

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_has_currentpoint ()
refsect2.para: This function is a boolean test checking to see if the path has a current point defined. Current point will be set by line operators, and cleared by closing subpath.

listitem.simpara: boolean, indicating if the path has a current point defined.

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_currentpoint ()
refsect2.para: Stores the current point of the path definition in the passed ArtPoint p.

listitem.simpara: a ArtPoint where to store the current point

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_last_bpath ()
refsect2.para: This function returns pointer to the last ArtBpath segment in the path definition.

listitem.simpara: ArtBpath, being the last segment in the path definition or null if no line segments have been defined.

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_first_bpath ()
refsect2.para: This function returns the first ArtBpath point in the definition.

listitem.simpara: ArtBpath being the first point in the path definition or null if no points are defined

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_any_open ()
refsect2.para: This function returns a boolean value indicating if the path has any open segments.

listitem.simpara: boolean, indicating if the path has any open segments.

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_all_open ()
refsect2.para: This function returns a boolean value indicating if the path only contains open segments.

listitem.simpara: boolean, indicating if the path has all open segments.

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_any_closed ()
refsect2.para: This function returns a boolean valid indicating if the path has any closed segements.

listitem.simpara: boolean, indicating if the path has any closed segments.

refsect2.title: gnome_canvas_path_def_all_closed ()
refsect2.para: This function returns a boolean value indicating if the path only contains closed segments.

listitem.simpara: boolean, indicating if the path has all closed segments.
